title: [BUG] MLflow Pipelines fails if space found in the repository Path (make: *** No rule to make target)

labels.name: area/recipes
labels.description: MLflow Recipes, Recipes APIs, Recipes configs, Recipe Templates

body:
### Willingness to contribute

Yes. I would be willing to contribute a fix for this bug with guidance from the MLflow community.

### MLflow version

1.27.0

### System information

- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Windows 11
- **Python version**: 3.7.13
- **yarn version, if running the dev UI**:


### Describe the problem

I was following the instruction on the [Regression Pipeline repository](https://github.com/mlflow/mlp-regression-template), where I cloned the repo in a folder called **MLflow Pipelines**. However, I got an error when I was trying to run `p.run("split")` cell in [jupyter.ipynb](https://github.com/mlflow/mlp-regression-template/blob/main/notebooks/jupyter.ipynb) notebook. The error:
`make: *** No rule to make target 'steps/split/outputs/train.parquet', needed by 'split'.  Stop.`

### Tracking information

_No response_

### Code to reproduce issue

Run the  [jupyter.ipynb](https://github.com/mlflow/mlp-regression-template/blob/main/notebooks/jupyter.ipynb) notebook after cloning the repo in a folder with space in it 

### Stack trace

make: *** No rule to make target 'steps/split/outputs/train.parquet', needed by 'split'.  Stop.

### Other info / logs

After some debugging, I found the problem in the **Makefile** created for the pipeline as it is space sensitive

- [ ] `area/server-infra`: MLflow Tracking server backend
- [ ] `area/tracking`: Tracking Service, tracking client APIs, autologging

### What interface(s) does this bug affect?

- [ ] `area/uiux`: Front-end, user experience, plotting, JavaScript, JavaScript dev server
- [ ] `area/docker`: Docker use across MLflow's components, such as MLflow Projects and MLflow Models
- [ ] `area/sqlalchemy`: Use of SQLAlchemy in the Tracking Service or Model Registry
- [ ] `area/windows`: Windows support

### What language(s) does this bug affect?

- [ ] `language/r`: R APIs and clients
- [ ] `language/java`: Java APIs and clients
- [ ] `language/new`: Proposals for new client languages

- [ ] `integrations/databricks`: Databricks integrations
